channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Illegal Posters, 16th August
item.description:
On Herbert Road at the junction with Avenue Road, Bexleyheath: Please could you remove to illegal advertising posters from a green street cabinet on the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Herbert Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish box's fan outside no 12 Philip walk, 16th August
item.description:
This is an on going problem with no12 Philip walk they have been reported on several occasions but they still continue to do this as there no one ever acts Upton there dumping of rubbish every one else has to dispose of there rubbish but no the council will just pick there rubbish up and dispose of it I think we should all just throw our rubbish out onto the street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Philip Walk, Peckham, London

item.title: Strong, unpleasant sulfurous reappearing smell, 16th August
item.description:
There is a very strong suflurous smell spreading down Ilderton Road and Old Kent Road next to Lidl. It greets you when you get off the train at SouthBermondsey station - a very embarrassing welcome. Sometimes it disappears but never for too long - it reappears again and at the moment is so strong that I had to close my windows. The other day I almost puked going to Lidl. Not the best thing to accompany you to and from grocery shopping. The other residents notice it as well - many complaints have been filed yet nothing is being done, and council isn’t responding when the clear culprits are the Southwark Council waste management facilities and the South Bermondsey incinerator. The trash around the latter speaks volumes about how much they actually care about the environment. Surrey Quey Road is littered with trash right on their doorstep - but that’s a separate matter. What exactly needs to be done to get the council to take some responsibility about all that stench? It’s unbearable, embarrassing and humiliating to be living in such area where the dignity of the residents and their right to clean fresh air are being ignored. Please do something, this simply isn’t right.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 217, Ilderton Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 217, Tabard Street, The Borough, London

item.title: Hedges blocking pavement, 16th August
item.description:
